title: Eduards Freimanis
text:
Eduards Freimanis (22 February 1919, in <a href="Liep%C4%81ja">Liepāja</a> - 1993) was a former <a href="Latvia">Latvia</a>n <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> forward, the first Latvian footballer to play with a professional club in <a href="England">England</a>.
Playing career.
Freimanis started playing football in the early 1930s with the youth squad of <a href="Olimpija%20Liep%C4%81ja">Olimpija Liepāja</a>. He played with the senior squad of Olimpija from 1937 to 1939, winning two <a href="Latvian%20Higher%20League">Latvian Higher League</a> titles. In 1939 he joined <a href="JKS%20Riga">JKS Riga</a>. In 1939 Freimanis was first capped for <a href="Latvia%20national%20football%20team">Latvia national football team</a> and scored two goals in his very first international match (he played his second international match the next year). In 1940 when Latvia was annexed by the <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet Union</a> and former Latvian sports clubs were disbanded, Freimanis joined <a href="RAFS%201">RAFS 1</a>, later he played with <a href="Dinamo%20Riga%20%28football%29">Dinamo Riga</a>. From 1941 to 1944 he played with <a href="Daugavie%C5%A1i">Daugavieši</a> and from 1942 to 1944 in the <a href="Riga">Riga</a> selected team. In 1942 with six goals scored Freimanis was the best goalscorer in the <a href="Latvian%20Higher%20League%201942">Latvian Higher League</a>.
After <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> Freimanis ended up in the West, from 1945 to 1946 he played in <a href="Greven">Greven</a>, the next season he moved to <a href="Holstein%20Kiel">Holstein Kiel</a>, helping them to finish runners-up in the <a href="Schleswig-Holstein">Schleswig-Holstein</a> championship play-offs in the summer of 1947 and in the following year he settled in <a href="England">England</a>. His first club there was the amateur side <a href="Eynesbury%20Rovers">Eynesbury Rovers</a>, but in the 1947/1948 season he became the first Latvian footballer to play in a professional English football club as he joined <a href="Peterborough%20United">Peterborough United</a> (in 21 match for the club he scored 22 goals), for two more seasons he played with <a href="Northampton%20Town%20F.C.">Northampton Town F.C.</a>, until finally he landed in <a href="Nuneaton%20Borough">Nuneaton Borough</a>, where he also worked as a coach for some time.
Honours.
